elements.description:
Element that provides pagination.

##### Usage

      <px-pagination number-of-items="{{numberOfItems}}" page-size="{{pageSize}}" first-item-index-to-display="{{firstItemIndex}}"></px-pagination>

properties.name: __localizationCache
properties.description:
Internal singleton cache. This is the private implementation of the
behaviour; don't interact with it directly.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
A valid IETF language tag as a string that `px-localize-behavior` will
use to localize this component. Refer to px-localize-behavior for currently supported languages.

See https://github.com/PolymerElements/app-localize-behavior for API
documentation and more information.

properties.name: resources
properties.description: Localizable strings for this component

properties.name: formats
useKeyIfMissing
properties.description:
Use the key for localization if value for  language is missing. Should
always be true for  our components

properties.name: localize
properties.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

properties.name: bubbleEvent
properties.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

properties.name: numberOfItems
properties.description: The total number of items.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: The size of a page.

properties.name: dataRemote
properties.description:
Changes paradigms for pagination from local (all data local)
VS remote (all data remote and only one page local)

properties.name: pageSizeOptions
properties.description: Options displayed in the page size dropdown.

properties.name: firstItemIndexToDisplay
properties.description:
Passes the firstItemIndexToDisplay back to the user

1-based

methods.name: __computeLocalize
methods.description: Returns a computed `localize` method, based on the current `language`.

methods.name: goToNextPage
methods.description: Go to the next page or trigger request to chagne page

methods.name: goToPageNumber
methods.description: Go to the page number specified

methods.name: goToPreviousPage
methods.description: Go to the previous page or trigger request to change page

methods.name: setPageSize
methods.description:
Set page size public interface.

Set Page size, trigger update of table, update dropdown.

methods.name: updateDisplay
methods.description: Update the display given current property values

methods.name: _conditionallyUpdateDisplay
methods.description:
If firstItemIndexToDisplay has changed, then update the display
Condition: dataRemote is true

If dataRemote is false, calling updateDisplay would
  cause a circular update cycle

Necessary if dataRemote is true to ensure that the currentPage
  and lastItemIndexToDisplay are appropriately updated

methods.name: _conditionallyUpdatePageSize
methods.description:
If pageSize has changed, then update the display
Condition: dataRemote is true

If dataRemote is false, calling _updatePageSize would
  cause a circular update cycle

Necessary if dataRemote is true to ensure that the currentPage
  and lastItemIndexToDisplay are appropriately updated

methods.name: _triggerPageChangeRequest
_triggerPageSizeChangeRequest

attributes.name: language
attributes.description:
A valid IETF language tag as a string that `px-localize-behavior` will
use to localize this component. Refer to px-localize-behavior for currently supported languages.

See https://github.com/PolymerElements/app-localize-behavior for API
documentation and more information.

attributes.description: Localizable strings for this component

attributes.name: formats
use-key-if-missing
attributes.description:
Use the key for localization if value for  language is missing. Should
always be true for  our components

string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

attributes.name: bubble-event
attributes.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

attributes.name: number-of-items
attributes.description: The total number of items.

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: The size of a page.

attributes.name: data-remote
attributes.description:
Changes paradigms for pagination from local (all data local)
VS remote (all data remote and only one page local)

attributes.name: page-size-options
attributes.description: Options displayed in the page size dropdown.

attributes.name: first-item-index-to-display
attributes.description:
Passes the firstItemIndexToDisplay back to the user

1-based

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.description: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

attributes.name: stop-keyboard-event-propagation
attributes.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

methods.name: _isEqual
methods.description:
This method checks whether the two parameters passed in are equal.
Please note you should use _areAnyEqual for passing in multiple options in an array.

methods.name: _areAnyEqual
methods.description:
This method checks whether the first parameter and ANY parameter passed in
the array are equal.

methods.name: _typeofComparison
methods.description: required by IE11

properties.name: html
properties.description: column name

attributes.name: html
attributes.description: column name

properties.name: __localizationCache
properties.description:
Internal singleton cache. This is the private implementation of the
behaviour; don't interact with it directly.

properties.name: language
properties.description: The language used for translation.

properties.name: resources
formats
useKeyIfMissing
properties.description:
If true, will use the provided key when
the translation does not exist for that key.

properties.name: localize
properties.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

properties.name: bubbleEvent
properties.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

properties.name: data
properties.description: data: instance of the model data

properties.name: meta
properties.description: meta: instance of the model meta

properties.name: selectedRows
properties.description: selected: all selected row will be referenced here.  Really only readable.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: selectable: if table row is selectable

properties.name: singleSelect
properties.description: single-select: if only one row can be selected

properties.name: striped
properties.description: striped: if table row is striped

properties.name: tableCells
properties.description: tableCells: if table row is striped

properties.name: tableColumns
properties.description: tableColumns: if table row is striped

properties.name: filterable
properties.description: filterable: if table row is filterable

properties.name: sortable
properties.description: filterable: if table columns are sortable

properties.name: _enableFilterRow
properties.description: _enableFilterRow: if table row is _enableFilterRow

properties.name: sortedColumn
properties.description: sortedColumn: sorted column name

properties.name: filteredColumns
properties.description: the column names that are filtered on

properties.name: displayedRows
properties.description: all rows that are currently displayed on the page (visible right now)

properties.name: descending
properties.description: descending: current sorting order

properties.name: totalEntries
properties.description:
Property to set the the total number of entries in the table,
assuming that dataRemote is true and the data provided is only
for the visible page.

Requires dataRemote="true" to take effect

     <px-data-table data-remote="true" page-size total-entries="100"  first-item-index="0" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: firstItemIndex
properties.description:
Property to set the the remote index of the first item on this page,
assuming that dataRemote is true and the data provided is only
for the visible page.

Requires dataRemote="true" to take effect

If on page 2 with a page size of 10, then the first-item-index would be 11.

     <px-data-table data-remote="true" page-size total-entries="100"  first-item-index="0" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: dataRemote
properties.description:
Property to set the the data paradigm.

If this is false, then px-data-table expects all of the data to be provided to it.

If this is true, then px-data-table will expect only one page's worth of data to be supplied.
This will require other fields to be set, e.g. page-size, total-entries, and first-item-index

     <px-data-table data-remote="true" page-size total-entries="100"  first-item-index="0" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description:
Property to set the page size instead of the default of 10.

In data-remote mode, page size may not match count of data provided.
Page size could be 50, but only 40 items are provided.

     <px-data-table page-size="50" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: _adaptedNumberOfItems
properties.description:
When dataRemote is true, then this reflects the total count on observer
and numberOfItems reflects count of items in tableProperty to track the number of items in the table

properties.name: numberOfItems
properties.description:
Property to track the number of items in the table

Without dataRemote==true, this will be the total number of items
With dataRemote==true this will either be the page size or the number of items if less than the page size

properties.name: hidePaginationControl
properties.description:
Property to set the visibility of the table pagination controls.

     <px-data-table hide-pagination-control="false" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: showColumnChooser
properties.description:
Property to set the visibility of the table column chooser (used
to show and hide columns)

properties.name: enableColumnReorder
properties.description:
Property to enable draggability of column headers for reordering
columns

properties.name: enableColumnResize
properties.description: Property to enable resizing of column headers through click and drag

properties.name: _columnChooserItems
properties.description: Array holding the column names in their displayed order

properties.name: _displayingInsertion
properties.description: Whether we're currently displaying an insertion column (when dragging columns)

properties.name: _headerInitialSize
properties.description: When currently resizing a header

properties.name: scrollBody
properties.description: scroll body html element

properties.name: pageSizeOptions
properties.description: Options displayed in the page size dropdown.

methods.name: __computeLocalize
methods.description: Returns a computed `localize` method, based on the current `language`.

methods.name: _setInternalDataAt
methods.description: set helper method so we don't have to sprinkle logic of this internal data structure throughout

methods.name: _getInternalDataAt
methods.description: get helper method so we don't have to sprinkle logic of this internal data structure throughout

methods.name: _triggerSortChangeRequest
_sort
methods.description: sort by header click handler

methods.name: _defaultSortAlphabetically
methods.description: fallback default sort function if per-column sort isn't specified.

methods.name: _triggerFilterChangeRequest
_filter
methods.description: filter on typed content in header handler

methods.name: hideColumn
methods.description: Hide the column which name matches columnName

methods.name: showColumn
methods.description:
show the column which name matches columnName if it has been hidden
previously

methods.name: _headerTrack
methods.description: Called when tracking a header resize

methods.name: _headerResizeMouseDown
methods.description: Called when initiating a header resize

methods.name: _findHeaderFromChild
methods.description: Searching for a .th parent element

methods.name: _typeofComparison
methods.description: required by IE11

elements.description:
This element defines column settings for a column within a `px-data-table`. If no `px-data-table-column` sub-components are passed in,
by default the table will display all columns that are found in the `table-data` array objects. If one or more column definitions are
included, the table will only display those columns. If the `include-all-columns` property is set to true on the `px-data-table`,
the table will first gather all of the columns from the `table-data` array, then override the settings for individual columns using
the `px-data-table-column` definitions provided.

### Usage

    <px-data-table-column name="first"></px-data-table-column>

The px-data-table-column component accepts both px-validation and px-data-table-highlight sub-components. For example:

    <px-data-table table-data="{{...}}">
      <px-data-table-column name="first" label="First Name" filterable sortable editable>
        <px-validation>
          <px-validator validation-method="isNumber" import="../px-validation/px-example-validator.html"></px-validator>
        </px-validation>
      </px-data-table-column>
    </px-data-table>

    <px-data-table table-data="{{...}}">
      <px-data-table-column name="first" label="First Name" filterable sortable editable>
        <px-data-table-highlight highlight-method="wordBeginsWithLetterJ" import="px-example-highlight.html">
        </px-data-table-highlight>
      </px-data-table-column>
    </px-data-table>

Use the dropdown at the top of this screen to see the API for `px-data-table` or `px-data-table-highlight`.
Click [here](https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-validation/) for more information on `px-validation`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the column. **Note:** must match the column name defined in the table-data property of parent px-data-table.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label to display in the table heading for this column.  If no label is provided, a title-cased version of the name property will be used by default.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Type of data in the column. Should be one of: string, html, dropdown. Strings will appear literally, whereas HTML content will be rendered.
Dropdowns allow users to pick from a provided set of options (see `dropdownItems`).

**WARNING!** Potential XSS vulnerability if `html` comes from an untrusted source

properties.name: sortable
properties.description:
If true, users can click on the column heading to sort table rows in a certain order (by default, alphabetically).
For custom sorting, see `sortFunctionName` property.
**Note:** parent component px-data-table must also have this property set to true.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: If true, users can click on a data table cell in this column and edit the contents.

properties.name: filterable
properties.description:
If true, a filter input will appear under the column heading which allows the user to filter the table contents.
For custom filtering, see `filterFunctionName` property.
**Note:** parent component px-data-table must also have this property set to true.

properties.name: disableSelect
properties.description:
If true, clicking a cell in this column will not select the row.
Useful for cells with rich content that should be interactive without triggering a toggle of the row's selection state.

properties.name: sortFunctionName
properties.description:
Full path to the custom function (attached to `window`) to sort this row with.
We highly suggest namespacing this function name so you don't pollute the global namespace and so you can have multiple datatables with different sorting functions.

     <px-data-table-column sort-function-name="temperatureTable.sortByDate" ...></px-data-table-column>

properties.name: filterFunctionName
properties.description:
Full path to the custom function (attached to `window`) to filter this row with.
We highly suggest namespacing this function name so you don't pollute the global namespace and so you can have multiple datatables with different filtering functions.

     <px-data-table-column filter-function-name="pressureTable.filterByNumber" ...></px-data-table-column>

properties.name: maxColumnCharacterWidth
properties.description:
Maximum number of characters to display in the column. Can be used in conjunction with `ellipsisClipPosition` property.
By defaul, the table will make the column as wide as necessary to display all of its content.

properties.name: ellipsisClipPosition
properties.description:
In conjunction with `maxColumnCharacterWidth`, this property dictates where to clip the data and put the ellipsis.
Should be one of: center, left, right.

properties.name: dropdownItems
properties.description: For columns of `type` "dropdown", this property dictates which options should be available in the dropdown.

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Whether the column should be hidden from view.

properties.name: disableHide
properties.description: Whether the column should show up in the column chooser or not.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Placeholder text for input boxes if this column is editable.

methods.name: validate
methods.description:
This method is used by `px-validation` sub-components to verify that editable cells follow a specific validation pattern.
If no validation/validator sub-components are specified, editable cells will always pass validation. Example usage:
```
<px-data-table-column ...>
   <px-validation>
     <px-validator validation-method="isNumber" import="../px-validation/px-example-validator.html"></px-validator>
   </px-validation>
</px-data-table-column>
```

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the column. **Note:** must match the column name defined in the table-data property of parent px-data-table.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Label to display in the table heading for this column.  If no label is provided, a title-cased version of the name property will be used by default.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Type of data in the column. Should be one of: string, html, dropdown. Strings will appear literally, whereas HTML content will be rendered.
Dropdowns allow users to pick from a provided set of options (see `dropdownItems`).

**WARNING!** Potential XSS vulnerability if `html` comes from an untrusted source

attributes.name: sortable
attributes.description:
If true, users can click on the column heading to sort table rows in a certain order (by default, alphabetically).
For custom sorting, see `sortFunctionName` property.
**Note:** parent component px-data-table must also have this property set to true.

attributes.name: editable
attributes.description: If true, users can click on a data table cell in this column and edit the contents.

attributes.name: filterable
attributes.description:
If true, a filter input will appear under the column heading which allows the user to filter the table contents.
For custom filtering, see `filterFunctionName` property.
**Note:** parent component px-data-table must also have this property set to true.

attributes.name: disable-select
attributes.description:
If true, clicking a cell in this column will not select the row.
Useful for cells with rich content that should be interactive without triggering a toggle of the row's selection state.

attributes.name: sort-function-name
attributes.description:
Full path to the custom function (attached to `window`) to sort this row with.
We highly suggest namespacing this function name so you don't pollute the global namespace and so you can have multiple datatables with different sorting functions.

     <px-data-table-column sort-function-name="temperatureTable.sortByDate" ...></px-data-table-column>

attributes.name: filter-function-name
attributes.description:
Full path to the custom function (attached to `window`) to filter this row with.
We highly suggest namespacing this function name so you don't pollute the global namespace and so you can have multiple datatables with different filtering functions.

     <px-data-table-column filter-function-name="pressureTable.filterByNumber" ...></px-data-table-column>

attributes.name: max-column-character-width
attributes.description:
Maximum number of characters to display in the column. Can be used in conjunction with `ellipsisClipPosition` property.
By defaul, the table will make the column as wide as necessary to display all of its content.

attributes.name: ellipsis-clip-position
attributes.description:
In conjunction with `maxColumnCharacterWidth`, this property dictates where to clip the data and put the ellipsis.
Should be one of: center, left, right.

attributes.name: dropdown-items
attributes.description: For columns of `type` "dropdown", this property dictates which options should be available in the dropdown.

attributes.name: hide
attributes.description: Whether the column should be hidden from view.

attributes.name: disable-hide
attributes.description: Whether the column should show up in the column chooser or not.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text for input boxes if this column is editable.

elements.description:
Element to define and configure highlighting behavior for a given column (and hence cell or row).

### Usage

    <px-data-table-highlight
      highlight-type="row"
      highlight-method="isLongString"
      import="px-example-highlight.html">
    </px-data-table-highlight>


### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--px-data-table-highlight--high` | A high highlight | `rgba($alert-red, 0.25)`
`--px-data-table-highlight--medium` | A medium highlight | `rgba($alert-yellow, 0.25)`
`--px-data-table-highlight--low` | A low highlight | `rgba($alert-blue, 0.25)`

properties.name: import
properties.description: A url that points to a file containing the JavaScript methods to be used for determining the highlighting behavior.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description: An object that holds the highlighting methods and attaches them to the window of the application.

properties.name: highlightMethod
properties.description:
A JavaScript method name from the file located at the `import` url.
Highlight method receives three parameters: cell value, row data, column name.

properties.name: highlightType
properties.description: Property for what actually gets highlighted - either 'cell' or 'row'.

properties.name: highlightValue
properties.description: Property to set the pre-defined style of a highlight based on severity. One of 'high', 'medium' or 'low' - the colors for these three highlight types can be configured using the style variables above.

methods.name: attached
methods.description: Loads the imported highlight function.

attributes.name: import
attributes.description: A url that points to a file containing the JavaScript methods to be used for determining the highlighting behavior.

attributes.name: highlight
attributes.description: An object that holds the highlighting methods and attaches them to the window of the application.

attributes.name: highlight-method
attributes.description:
A JavaScript method name from the file located at the `import` url.
Highlight method receives three parameters: cell value, row data, column name.

attributes.name: highlight-type
attributes.description: Property for what actually gets highlighted - either 'cell' or 'row'.

attributes.name: highlight-value
attributes.description: Property to set the pre-defined style of a highlight based on severity. One of 'high', 'medium' or 'low' - the colors for these three highlight types can be configured using the style variables above.

elements.description:
Element that defines a data table, optionally using a sub-element for advanced column settings.
Use the dropdown at the top of this screen to see documentation on the `px-data-table-column` and `px-data-table-highlight` sub-components.

### Client-Side VS Server-Side Data Paradigms

There are two main paradigms for the source of data in a table.

In a *Client-Side* model, the browser makes one request for the _complete set_ of data.
This means that sorting, filtering, and pagination all happen in memory on the client.
While this produces snappy tables with reasonably sized data sets, it can lead to a sluggish UI
for larger data sets. This works great with data sets that don't change frequently,
since the full payload would have to be resent for every update.

In a *Server-Side* model, the browser makes a request for a _subset_ of data for a particular page.
Sorting, filtering, and pagination requests will have to be made to a service for a new _subset_ of data
that matches the user's intended criteria. This prevents the browser from being overwhelmed with excessively
large data sets by only exposing one page's worth of data at a time. This is ideal for larger data sets or
where it is preferable to make multiple small requests instead of fewer larger requests. Due to the increased
frequency of requests, the UI is more likely to display data in sync with the server.

### Client-Side Data Usage

See the `README.md` and `docs` files in the repo for more details and advanced examples.

Minimum:

    <px-data-table table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

Advanced:

    <px-data-table filterable selectable striped table-data="{{data}}">
      // See px-data-table-column API using dropdown at top of screen.
      <px-data-table-column name="first" ...></px-data-table-column>
      <px-data-table-column name="last" ...></px-data-table-column>
      <px-data-table-column name="color" ...></px-data-table-column>
      <px-data-table-column name="date" ...></px-data-table-column>
    </px-data-table>

### Server-Side Data Usage

See the `README.md` and `docs` files in the repo for more details and advanced examples.

For container element `ContainerEl`, create the following event listeners and request new data based on the user-intended change. Upon receiving updated data, update the variables bound to the `table-data`, `total-entries`, and `first-item-index` attributes.

Minimum:

    <px-data-table
      total-entries="100"
      first-item-index="11"
      table-data="{{dataSubset}}"
      remote-data="true"
      >
    </px-data-table>

Advanced:

In the following example `serverResponse` is an object that is updated upon the response of a server.

    <px-data-table
      id="remoteDataTable"
      total-entries="{{serverResponse.totalRecordsCount}}"
      first-item-index="{{serverResponse.recordIndexOfSubset}}"
      table-data="{{serverResponse.dataSubset}}"
      remote-data="true"
      >
      <px-data-table-column
        name="first"
        sortable
        filter-function-name="myTableCustomFunctions.filterWholeWord"
        sort-function-name="myTableCustomFunctions.sortByEmailDomain">
      </px-data-table-column>
      <px-data-table-column name="last"></px-data-table-column>
      <px-data-table-column name="color"></px-data-table-column>
      <px-data-table-column name="date"></px-data-table-column>
    </px-data-table>


### Integrating with other frameworks (ex: Angular):

You may not be able to use 2-way binding with the objects/arrays in other frameworks such as Angular.

We suggest instead to use events and selectors, for example:

    document.getElementById("myDataTable").addEventListener("px-row-click", function(e) {
        ...
    });

    document.getElementById("myDataTable").addEventListener("px-select-all-click", function(e) {
        ...
    });

    $scope.doSomethingWithSelectedRows = function() {
        $scope.allSelectedRows = document.getElementById("myDataTable").selectedRows;
    };

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
----------------|-------------
`--px-data-table-border-color` | The table border color
`--px-data-table-separator-color` | The table separator color
`--px-data-table-header-text-color` | The text color of header rows
`--px-data-table-header-background-color` | The background color of header rows
`--px-data-table-row-background-color--hover` | The background color of a row when hovered
`--px-data-table-row-cursor--hover` | The cursor style of a row when hovered
`--px-data-table-cell-border-color--edit` | The cell border color when in edit mode
`--px-data-table-cell-border-color--selected` | The cell border color when selected
`--px-data-table-cell-border-validation--failed` | The cell border color when validation fails
`--px-data-table-cell-background-color--selected` | The cell background color when selected
`--px-data-table-cell-background-color--edit` | The cell background color when in edit mode
`--px-data-table-background-color-striped--even` | The background color of a striped cell (even)
`--px-data-table-cell-text-color--selected` | The cell text color when selected
`--px-data-table-cell-text-color-validation--failed` | The cell text color when validation fails
`--px-data-table-cell-text-color--sorted` | The text color of a sorted column
`--px-data-table-cell-text-color--editing` | The text color of a cell in edit mode
`--px-data-table-results-text-color--none` | The text color for the "no results" message
`--px-data-table-insertion-indicator-td-background-color` | The color of the insertion indicator for reordering
`--px-data-table-text-input-background-color--filter` | The background color of a filter input box
`--px-data-table-text-color--dragged` | The text color of a dragged item
`--px-data-table-text-color--hover` | The text color of a column header when hovered
`--px-data-table-highlight--high` | A highlight of value 'high'
`--px-data-table-highlight--medium` | A highlight of value 'medium'
`--px-data-table-highlight--low` | A highlight of value 'low'
`--px-data-table-padding-top` | The top padding for table cells
`--px-data-table-padding-bottom` |  The bottom padding for table cells
`--px-data-table-padding-left` |  The left padding for table cells
`--px-data-table-padding-right` |  The right padding for table cells

properties.name: __localizationCache
properties.description:
Internal singleton cache. This is the private implementation of the
behaviour; don't interact with it directly.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
A valid IETF language tag as a string that `app-localize-behavior` will
use to localize this component.

See https://github.com/PolymerElements/app-localize-behavior for API
documentation and more information.

properties.name: resources
properties.description:
A dictionary of strings used within the component for AppLocalizeBehavior
to use, based on the selected `language` property.
properties.defaultValue: {"en":{"Selected":"Selected","of":"of","Show/Hide Column":"Show/Hide Column","Filter":"Filter","Rows per page":"Rows per page","No Results":"No Results"}}

properties.name: formats
localize
properties.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

properties.name: bubbleEvent
properties.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

properties.name: tableData
properties.description:
Data for the table to display.

Expected data format is just a JSON array.  Each object in the array represents a row in the table.

Each item in an object will be displayed as a separate column, unless px-data-table-columns are defined to limit which columns are displayed.
See also includeAllColumns.

    Expected format:
    [
      {
       "index": 0,
       "name": "Liz Grimes",
       "image": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/uifaces/faces/twitter/enda/73.jpg",
       "date": "Sun Aug 14 1994 03:27:03 GMT-0700 (PDT)"
     },
     {
       "index": 1,
       "name": "Frazier Lara",
       "image": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/uifaces/faces/twitter/guillogo/73.jpg",
       "date": "Tue May 24 1988 14:10:20 GMT-0700 (PDT)",
     }
   ]

properties.name: striped
properties.description: If true, every other row in the table will appear with a background color to improve visual scanning.

properties.name: filterable
properties.description:
If true, a row of filter inputs will appear under the column headings which allow the user to filter the table's contents.
If columns are specified with px-data-table-column, they must also have a filterable property to enable filtering for that column.
For custom filtering, see `filterFunctionName` in the px-data-table-column API using the dropdown at the top of this screen.

properties.name: sortable
properties.description:
If true, users can click on a column heading to sort table rows in a certain order (by default, alphabetically).
If columns are specified with px-data-table-column, they must also have a sortable property to enable sorting for that column.
For custom sorting, see `sortFunctionName` in the px-data-table-column API using the dropdown at the top of this screen.

properties.name: tableColumns
properties.description: If true, the table will only appear with vertical borders.

properties.name: tableCells
properties.description: If true, the table will appear with both horizontal and vertical borders.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: Use the selectable property if one or more rows within the table should be selectable. See also `singleSelect`.

properties.name: singleSelect
properties.description: Use this property if only one row should be selectable at a time (radio button vs checkbox). The Select All checkbox will be hidden if `singleSelect` is true.

properties.name: hidePaginationControl
properties.description: Whether or not the table pagination controls should be hidden.

properties.name: totalEntries
properties.description:
Property to set the the total number of entries in the table,
assuming that dataRemote is true and the data provided is only
for the visible page.

Requires dataRemote="true" to take effect

     <px-data-table data-remote="true" page-size total-entries="100"  first-item-index="0" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: firstItemIndex
properties.description:
Property to set the the remote index of the first item on this page,
assuming that dataRemote is true and the data provided is only
for the visible page.

Requires dataRemote="true" to take effect

If on page 2 with a page size of 10, then the first-item-index would be 11.

     <px-data-table data-remote="true" page-size total-entries="100"  first-item-index="0" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: dataRemote
properties.description:
Property to set the the data paradigm.

Local means all data is local.
Remote means that only one page's worth of data is local.

If this is false, then px-data-table expects all of the data to be provided to it.

If this is true, then px-data-table will expect only one page's worth of data to be supplied.
This will require other fields to be set, e.g. page-size, total-entries, and first-item-index

     <px-data-table data-remote="true" page-size total-entries="100"  first-item-index="0" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description:
The default page size (number of visible rows) used in the pagination controls.

Even in data-remote mode, page size may not match count of data provided.
Page size could be 50, but only 40 items are provided.

     <px-data-table page-size="50" table-data="{{data}}"></px-data-table>

properties.name: selectedRows
properties.description: Selected rows in the data table, setup for binding. This property is read only.

properties.name: showColumnChooser
properties.description: If true, a table column chooser will appear above the table, allowing the user to show and hide columns.

properties.name: enableColumnReorder
properties.description: If true, users can drag a column header from one location to another in order to reorder the columns.

properties.name: enableColumnResize
properties.description:
Property to enable resizing of column headers through click and drag on
the right border of the header.
If there is no space available then resizing won't be possible (i.e all
columns already to their minimum size, typically when the table can't
be displayed entirely)

properties.name: includeAllColumns
properties.description:
By default, if you specify one or more `<px-data-table-column>` sub-component
definitions, the table will only render those columns. By setting this boolean
to true, the data table will include **all** columns of data found in table-data,
with default settings **unless** you override these settings by including a
`<px-data-table-column>` definition for that column. The `sortable` and `filterable`
properties for each column will default to the current settings at the table level.

properties.name: pageSizeOptions
properties.description: Options displayed in the page size dropdown.

methods.name: __computeLocalize
methods.description: Returns a computed `localize` method, based on the current `language`.

attributes.name: language
attributes.description:
A valid IETF language tag as a string that `app-localize-behavior` will
use to localize this component.

See https://github.com/PolymerElements/app-localize-behavior for API
documentation and more information.

to use, based on the selected `language` property.

    Expected format:

       "image": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/uifaces/faces/twitter/guillogo/73.jpg",
       "date": "Tue May 24 1988 14:10:20 GMT-0700 (PDT)",
     }
   ]

Property to set the the total number of entries in the table,
assuming that dataRemote is true and the data provided is only

If this is true, then px-data-table will expect only one page's worth of data to be supplied.

By default, if you specify one or more `<px-data-table-column>` sub-component

attributes.name: page-size-options
attributes.description: Options displayed in the page size dropdown.
